intro: Thryallis latifolia f. typica, commonly known as the broadleaf thryallis, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with glossy, elliptical leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and numerous stamens, making it a striking addition to gardens. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
